title: Taking up the ‘Non-White Man’s Burden’: President Rajapakse should not miss this unique opportunity
content: – by Shenali D. Waduge – “White man’s burden” was a phrase coined by author Rudyard Kipling in 1899. It referred to the idea that white races in Europe and the United States had a responsibility to educate and Christianize “uncivilized” and “primitive” peoples of the world. ‘Burden’ implied a moral rationale lending it…
